info.name: Vihar360 Documentation
info.description:
StartFragment

Welcome to the **Vihar360 API Documentation**. This API provides a set of endpoints for managing users, authentication, and property listings in a real estate application.

### **Key Features:**

✅ User authentication (Signup, Signin, Google OAuth, Signout)  
  
✅ User profile management (Update, Delete, Fetch user details)  
  
✅ Property listings management (Create, Update, Delete, Fetch)  
  
✅ Secure access using authentication tokens

EndFragment

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
### Auth Signup

This endpoint allows users to sign up by providing a username, email, and password.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string) - The username of the user.
    
- `email` (string) - The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string) - The password for the user account.
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
"User created successfully!"

 ```

The `POST` request is used to sign in to the API at the specified endpoint. The request body should contain the user's email and password in JSON format.

### Request Body

- `email`: (text) The email of the user.
    
- `password`: (text) The password of the user.
    

Upon successful execution, the API returns a `200` status with a JSON response containing user information. The response includes the user's ID, username, email, avatar, creation and update timestamps, and a version field.

### Response

- `Content-Type`: application/json
    
- `"_id"`: The unique identifier of the user.
    
- `"username"`: The username of the user.
    
- `"email"`: The email of the user.
    
- `"avatar"`: The avatar URL of the user.
    
- `"createdAt"`: The timestamp of user creation.
    
- `"updatedAt"`: The timestamp of last update.
    
- `"__v"`: Version control field.

### Sign Out

This endpoint is used to sign out the current user.

#### Request Body

This endpoint does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json

item.description: Handles user registration, login, Google authentication, and signout to ensure secure access to the platform.

item.name: User

request.description:
### GET /api/user/test

This endpoint retrieves test data for a user.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following result:

``` json
{
    "message": "Api route is working!"
}

 ```

The response will contain a `message` key with a string value.

This endpoint is used to update user information with a specific user ID. The HTTP POST request should be sent to [http://localhost:3000/api/user/update/67d1b6977ad81ef868cec231](http://localhost:3000/api/user/update/67d1b6977ad81ef868cec231) with the user information in the request body.

### Request Body

- `username`: (string) The new username for the user.
    

### Response

Upon successful execution, the endpoint returns a status code of 200 and a JSON object with the updated user information. The response includes the following fields:

- `_id`: The user ID
    
- `username`: The updated username
    
- `email`: The user's email
    
- `avatar`: The user's avatar
    
- `createdAt`: Timestamp of user creation
    
- `updatedAt`: Timestamp of user information update
    
- `__v`: Version key

This endpoint is used to delete a specific user with the provided user ID.

### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `http://localhost:3000/api/user/delete/67d1b6977ad81ef868cec231`
    

### Response

The response for this request is an empty JSON object with a status code of 200.

``` json
"User has been deleted!"

 ```

# Get User Listings

This endpoint retrieves the listings for a specific user.

## Request

### HTTP Request

`GET http://localhost:3000/api/user/listings/67d1bb247ad81ef868cec236`

## Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
[
    {
        "_id": "",
        "name": "",
        "description": "",
        "address": "",
        "regularPrice": 0,
        "bathrooms": 0,
        "bedrooms": 0,
        "furnished": true,
        "parking": true,
        "type": "",
        "offer": true,
        "imageUrls": [""],
        "userRef": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
]

 ```

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve user information based on the provided user ID. The response will include details such as the user's ID, username, email, avatar, creation date, update date, and a version field.

### Request Body

This endpoint does not require a request body.

### Response Body

- `_id` (string): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `username` (string): The username of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `avatar` (string): The URL of the user's avatar.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the user was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the user was last updated.
    
- `__v` (number): Version control field.

item.description: Manages user profiles, updates, deletions, and retrieves user-specific data, including their listed properties.

request.description:
### Create Listing

This endpoint allows you to create a new listing.

#### Request Body

- `userRef` (string) - The reference ID of the user creating the listing.
    
- `name` (string) - The name/title of the listing.
    
- `description` (string) - A detailed description of the listing.
    
- `address` (string) - The address of the listing.
    
- `sale` (boolean) - Indicates if the listing is for sale.
    
- `rent` (boolean) - Indicates if the listing is for rent.
    
- `parking` (boolean) - Indicates if parking is available.
    
- `furnished` (boolean) - Indicates if the listing is furnished.
    
- `type` (string) - The type of the listing (e.g., house, apartment).
    
- `offer` (boolean) - Indicates if there is any special offer.
    
- `bedrooms` (number) - The number of bedrooms in the listing.
    
- `bathrooms` (number) - The number of bathrooms in the listing.
    
- `regularPrice` (number) - The regular price of the listing.
    
- `imageUrls` (array of strings) - URLs of images for the listing.
    

#### Response (201 - Created)

The response is an array of objects with the following properties:

- `name` (string) - The name/title of the listing.
    
- `description` (string) - A detailed description of the listing.
    
- `address` (string) - The address of the listing.
    
- `regularPrice` (number) - The regular price of the listing.
    
- `bathrooms` (number) - The number of bathrooms in the listing.
    
- `bedrooms` (number) - The number of bedrooms in the listing.
    
- `furnished` (boolean) - Indicates if the listing is furnished.
    
- `parking` (boolean) - Indicates if parking is available.
    
- `type` (string) - The type of the listing (e.g., house, apartment).
    
- `offer` (boolean) - Indicates if there is any special offer.
    
- `imageUrls` (array of strings) - URLs of images for the listing.
    
- `userRef` (string) - The reference ID of the user who created the listing.
    
- `_id` (string) - The unique ID of the created listing.
    
- `createdAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the listing was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the listing was last updated.
    
- `__v` (number) - Version key for the listing.

response.name: Create Listing

request.description:
### GET /api/listing/get/{listingId}

This endpoint retrieves details of a specific listing identified by the `listingId`.

#### Request

No request body parameters are required for this request.

- `listingId` (path parameter) - The unique identifier of the listing.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "_id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "address": "string",
  "regularPrice": 0,
  "bathrooms": 0,
  "bedrooms": 0,
  "furnished": true,
  "parking": true,
  "type": "string",
  "offer": true,
  "imageUrls": ["string"],
  "userRef": "string",
  "createdAt": "string",
  "updatedAt": "string",
  "__v": 0
}

 ```

- `_id` (string) - The unique identifier of the listing.
    
- `name` (string) - The name of the listing.
    
- `description` (string) - The description of the listing.
    
- `address` (string) - The address of the listing.
    
- `regularPrice` (number) - The regular price of the listing.
    
- `bathrooms` (number) - The number of bathrooms in the listing.
    
- `bedrooms` (number) - The number of bedrooms in the listing.
    
- `furnished` (boolean) - Indicates if the listing is furnished.
    
- `parking` (boolean) - Indicates if parking is available.
    
- `type` (string) - The type of the listing.
    
- `offer` (boolean) - Indicates if there is an offer available for the listing.
    
- `imageUrls` (array of strings) - URLs of images associated with the listing.
    
- `userRef` (string) - Reference to the user associated with the listing.
    
- `createdAt` (string) - Timestamp indicating when the listing was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string) - Timestamp indicating when the listing was last updated.
    
- `__v` (number) - Version key for the listing.

response.name: Get Single Listing
response.body:
{
    "_id": "67d1bbb97ad81ef868cec239",
    "name": "Elegant 3BHK House",
    "description": "A beautifully designed 3BHK house with a spacious garden and garage, located in a peaceful neighborhood.",
    "address": "101 Maple Street, Chicago, IL",
    "regularPrice": 350000,
    "bathrooms": 3,
    "bedrooms": 3,
    "furnished": false,
    "parking": true,
    "type": "house",
    "offer": false,
    "imageUrls": [
        "https://example.com/images/house1.jpg",
        "https://example.com/images/house2.jpg"
    ],
    "userRef": "67d1bb247ad81ef868cec236",
    "createdAt": "2025-03-12T16:52:09.891Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-03-12T16:52:09.891Z",
    "__v": 0
}

request.description:
### GET /api/listing/get/

This endpoint retrieves a list of listings.

#### Request

No request body is required for this request.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON array containing objects with the following properties:

- `_id` (string): The unique identifier for the listing.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the listing.
    
- `description` (string): A description of the listing.
    
- `address` (string): The address of the listing.
    
- `regularPrice` (number): The regular price of the listing.
    
- `bathrooms` (number): The number of bathrooms in the listing.
    
- `bedrooms` (number): The number of bedrooms in the listing.
    
- `furnished` (boolean): Indicates if the listing is furnished.
    
- `parking` (boolean): Indicates if parking is available for the listing.
    
- `type` (string): The type of the listing.
    
- `offer` (boolean): Indicates if there is an offer available for the listing.
    
- `imageUrls` (array of strings): URLs of images associated with the listing.
    
- `userRef` (string): Reference to the user associated with the listing.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the listing was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the listing was last updated.
    
- `__v` (number): Version key for the listing object.
    

``` json
[
  {
    "_id": "",
    "name": "",
    "description": "",
    "address": "",
    "regularPrice": 0,
    "bathrooms": 0,
    "bedrooms": 0,
    "furnished": true,
    "parking": true,
    "type": "",
    "offer": true,
    "imageUrls": [""],
    "userRef": "",
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0
  }
]

 ```

request.description:
### Update Listing Details

This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific listing.

#### Request Body

- `name`: (string) The updated name of the listing.
    
- `bedrooms`: (string) The updated number of bedrooms in the listing.
    

#### Response

Upon successful update, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing the updated details of the listing. The response includes the updated `name`, `bedrooms`, `furnished`, `parking`, `imageUrls`, and other listing details.

response.name: Update Listing

    "address": "101 Maple Street, Chicago, IL",
    "regularPrice": 350000,
    "bathrooms": 3,
    "bedrooms": 5,
    "furnished": false,
    "parking": true,
    "type": "house",
    "offer": false,
    "imageUrls": [
        "https://example.com/images/house1.jpg",
        "https://example.com/images/house2.jpg"
    ],
    "userRef": "67d1bb247ad81ef868cec236",
    "createdAt": "2025-03-12T16:52:09.891Z",

    "__v": 0

request.description:
This endpoint is used to delete a specific listing identified by its unique ID. The HTTP DELETE request should be sent to [http://localhost:3000/api/listing/delete/67d1bbb97ad81ef868cec23c](http://localhost:3000/api/listing/delete/67d1bbb97ad81ef868cec23c).

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response

Upon successful deletion, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and an empty JSON response.

item.description: Provides endpoints for creating, updating, deleting, and fetching real estate property listings for buyers and sellers.
